author: Peter Wright
content:
Thhe biggest problem was cutting through the propellor shaft which appears to have gine well.

Well done chaps!

author: Willy
content: The oil is likely to be the fuel tanks. As the inline engines are dry sumps with forced lubrication. IE the crank case isnt like an automotive type engine with vast quantities of oil for crankshaft and rods to splash into.

author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content: I read elsewhere that they were expecting escaping oils after this cut as it was in way of the engine room with all the associated ancillaries from which fluids could not be easily drained completely before cutting.

author: Rick Spilman
content: I don’t know. My guess is that they would prefer not to have to cut through the engine block in any case.

author: Willy
content: Did they manage the cut so the engine can be resold after getting a overhaul?
